result.execSummary:
The defendant Tejay Allen Skordahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tejay Allen Skordahl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tejay Allen Skordahl was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Court notes 8 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CF25.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CF25.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time,
Huber granted for work release.
May serve in Pepin County Jail if at no expense to St. Croix County Jail and with approval from both Sheriff's.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CF25, 16TR406 and 16TR407:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Tejay Allen Skordahl appeared from jail. Case called at 8:35 a.m. Court notes this matter was scheduled for a jury trial. There is a resolution. ADA Minser recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine w/o repeater in 16CF25 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine w/o enhancer in 16CF25. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CF25. Also dismisses 16TR406 and 16TR407. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders:

-   S/W 3 years probation. 60 day conditional jail time. 8 days jail credit in the event of revocation. Huber granted for work release. May serve in Pepin County Jail if no expense to St Croix County Jail. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  DNA Sample and DNA Sucharge of $250.00 

- Court costs in the amount of $268.00

of Commitment Transport. Signed by RMW. c: DA, cc: SCSO, Fax: SCSO and Jail. km
Fax from DE who is currently in the Pepin Co Jail requesting transport for the final pre-trial. hml

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Alexis McKinley DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Tejay Allen Skordahl did not appear. Case called at 8:55 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a final pre-trial. Court reviews file. DE is currently incarcerated in the Pepin Co Jail. Atty Schwab makes statement. Still trying to settle this matter. Has no witnesses and not requesting any non standard jury instructions. No Motions in Limine. State has filed witness list. No juror questions. Will be permitted to take notes during testimony only. Court will conduct Voir Dire. Atty Schwab will give opening statement. Court advises if there is a settlement, contact JA to remove trial from calendar.
